TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
17 Edward.
SEint Edward þe ȝungue &punctelev; was k&ydot;ng of Enguelonde
Wel ȝoung he imartred was &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ tricherie and onde
Þo is Moder moder þe guode Quene quene &punctelev; ase god God wolde was ded
his fader nam an oþur wijf &punctelev; þat luþur was and qued
Þat sent Sent
Edward louede lu&ydot;te &punctelev; and euere radde luþur red
Bi hure he hadde ane oþur sone &punctelev; þat ihote was Atheld&rrot;ed
¶Þe Quene quene louede hire owene [sone][om.] &punctelev; ase ech man deth is blod
Ake seint Seint
Edward heo louede lu&ydot;te &punctelev; fo&rrot; &slong;tepmoder is selde guod
heo wilnede mo&rrot;e þane aniþing &punctelev; þat seint Seint
Edward ded were
Þat hire owene sone aftur þe king &punctelev; þe heritage bere
Þo þe king wende out of þis wo&rrot;ld &punctelev; seint Edward and[r. as?] is sone
Aftur him was king jmad &punctelev; ase lawe was and wone
¶Þe guodnesse of þis ȝoungue king &punctelev; ne ma&ydot; no man telle
he was meoke and milde inouȝ &punctelev; and fair of flechs and felle
Debonere fo&rrot;to speke with &punctelev; ant with pouere men me&slong;t
Cha&slong;te and wis of conseil &punctelev; and p&rrot;u&ydot;te he louede le&slong;t
W&ydot;lde Men men ne louede he nouȝt &punctelev; þat rechelese weren of þouȝte
And wise Men men to him he d&rrot;ouȝ &punctelev; and aftur heom he wrouȝte
Aftur þe Erchebischope of Caunterburij &punctelev; seint Dun&slong;ton þat was þo
Ech dede þat he wolde do &punctelev; þe me&slong;te del scholde go
Glad was þe holie man of him &punctelev; and al þat lond also
Of swuch a king þat heo&rrot;e louerd was &punctelev; þat alle þing wolde wel do
Guod pais þare was in Enguelonde &punctelev; and loue and muruþe inovȝ
Richesse and al oþur guod &punctelev; elles it were ȝwovȝ
Fo&rrot; ȝwanne þat heued hathþ gode&slong; Godes grace &punctelev; and loueth alle guode
Wonder it were bote alle his &punctelev; þe betere heom onder&slong;tode
¶ To þe guodnesse of þis holie Man man &punctelev; þe deuel hadde envie
And is &slong;tepmoder þe luþere Quene quene &punctelev; þat ful was of tricherie
Fo&rrot; heo þouȝte Niȝht niȝht and da&ydot; &punctelev; ȝif heo miȝhte in ani manere
Þat seint Seint
Edward were aslawe &punctelev; and hire sone k&ydot;ng were
Fo&rrot; he was elde&slong;t aftur him &punctelev; and þe kingues sone also
Þis luþere wumman narewe hire biþouȝte &punctelev; hou þis miȝhte beo do
To some þat weren hire conseilers &punctelev; hire luþere þouȝt he[= heo] seide
þat hu&ydot; holpen with some G&ydot;le gyle &punctelev; to don þat luþere dede
Þis luþere[MS. þuþere]
Men men also fo&rrot;thþ with hire &punctelev; weren in grete þouȝte
With ȝwuche g&ydot;le hu&ydot; miȝhten do &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; to ende [it] b&rrot;ouȝte
¶So þat heo hadde to hire conseil &punctelev; Inowe inowe atþenende
Fo&rrot; fellere þing nis non ase wumman &punctelev; ȝware heo wole to vuele wende
Nadde þis ȝungue king ibeo &punctelev; in is k&ydot;nedom vnneþe
Bote þreo ȝer and E&ydot;ȝhte eyȝhte dawes &punctelev; þat he nas ib&rrot;ouȝt to deþe
Fo&rrot; a da&ydot; he wente on hontethþ &punctelev; with is kniȝhtes bi cas
In a fa&ydot;r wode in deo&rrot;sete &punctelev; þat biside wara&ydot;gne was
Fair wode þare was þulke t&ydot;me &punctelev; ake nouþe heo is al adoune
Bote þo&rrot;nes and þunne boskes &punctelev; þat &slong;tondeth bisides þe toune
¶Ase þis ȝoungue king wende on hontethþ &punctelev; a gret wille him cam to
Fo&rrot;te seo is ȝoungue[MS. ȝonngue] b&rrot;oþur &punctelev; and in eche manere he wolde it do
Fo&rrot; he was þere a lu&ydot;te biside &punctelev; ase is &slong;tepmoder was
In a toun þat men clepeden Co&rrot;f &punctelev; þat bote þreo Mile mile þanne it nas
A &slong;trong ca&slong;tel þare is nouþe &punctelev; ake þe ȝu&ydot;t nas non þere
Þis holie man þouȝte longue &punctelev; are he at is b&rrot;oþur were
Ane fewe men with him he nam &punctelev; and þuderward he gan ride
his Men men pleiden and Arnden arnden bi þe weie &punctelev; and sp&rrot;adden aboute ful wide
So þat with heom[r. him] ne bilefde non &punctelev; al one he was sone
Ake naþeles fo&rrot;th he wende is wei &punctelev; ase he þouȝte to done
Þe court he biheold afer &punctelev; þare ase is b&rrot;oþer was
Þudere he wende wel mildeliche &punctelev; ake no man with him nas
he ne þouȝte to no man bote guod &punctelev; ne no man he nadde misdo
Towar[d] is deþe fo&rrot;thþ he wende &punctelev; and mildeliche also
Þo is &slong;tepmoder þe luþere Quiene quiene &punctelev; al one iseiȝ him come
heo þouȝte to don hire wille of him &punctelev; ase heo hadde hire red inome
Þe luþere Men men heo cleopede sone &punctelev; þat weren at hire rede
And bispeken bi ȝwuche feolonie &punctelev; to don þis luþere dede
¶þo þis holie Man man was neiȝ icome &punctelev; þe Quiene quiene aȝein him eode
With fair Me˙ne meyne and gret honour &punctelev; and gret loue gan him beode
þe fe&slong;te þat heo with him made &punctelev; no tongue telle ne ma&ydot;
And swo&rrot; þat he scholde aliȝte &punctelev; and with hire bileue alda&ydot;
Nai certes dame seide þis king &punctelev; so ne ma&ydot; it nouȝt beo
Ake lat me speke with mi b&rrot;oþur &punctelev; fo&rrot; me longueth him to seo
Fo&rrot; er þane ich him habbe iseiȝe &punctelev; Ine wo&rrot;þe nouȝt bliþe iwis
Min heo&rrot;te is so muche opon him &punctelev; and no wonder it nis.
¶A sire quath þe luþere Quiene quiene &punctelev; ȝwane it ne mot oþur beo
Fur&slong;t ichulle to þe d&rrot;inke &punctelev; and þu schalt him sethþe iseo
Iredi was þe Botiler botiler &punctelev; and b&rrot;ouȝte him d&rrot;inke anon
Among þe oþere þat þare weren &punctelev; o schrewe þare cam gon
And welcomede him with fair semblaunt &punctelev; and made him Io&ydot;e ioye inovȝ
And cu&slong;te him Iudases cos &punctelev; and sone him þere aslovȝ
Fo&rrot; ase he &slong;toupede and cu&slong;te him &punctelev; redi he was inovȝ
Þo&rrot;uȝ is wombe he smot a knijf &punctelev; and is gottes altod&rrot;ovȝ
Þis holie Man man sat up&rrot;iȝht &punctelev; and biheold is deþes wounde
he ne rod bote wel lu&ydot;te wei &punctelev; are he feol to grounde
And liet þere is swete lijf &punctelev; is soule to heouene wende
Alas lu&ydot;tel vuel þouȝte he &punctelev; þo þe schrewe is wombe rende
Ake he was luþur ase Iudas &punctelev; þat so feolliche him cu&slong;te
And with tricherie is wombe rende &punctelev; are he it euere wu&slong;te
Þo þis holie Man man imartred was &punctelev; hu&ydot; þat him b&rrot;ouȝten þerto
Biþouȝten hou hu&ydot; miȝhten be&slong;t &punctelev; with þis holie bodie do
Into a dierne &slong;tude hu&ydot; wenden &punctelev; and þarinne is bodi hu&ydot; ca&slong;te
Wel filliche and &slong;tilleliche &punctelev; and bureden it þare wel fa&slong;te
¶ þo þis holie Man man imartred was &punctelev; þe Quiene quiene hadde hire wille
Fo&rrot; liȝhtliche Men men holdeth euere with þe quike &punctelev; and þe dede is sone &slong;tille
Men nomen þo þat child Aþeld&rrot;ed &punctelev; þat was þe Quiene quiene sone
And aftur is b&rrot;oþur mauden him king &punctelev; as riȝht was and wone
¶Þe heiȝe men alle of þe lond &punctelev; with him heolden echon
Ase with heo&rrot;e p&rrot;ince and heo&rrot;e louerd &punctelev; and þene dede fo&rrot;ȝete anon
Ake among lowe Men men and simple &punctelev; deol þere was inouȝ
hu&ydot; co&rrot;seden alle withoute god God &punctelev; þat heo&rrot;e louerd aslouȝ
Alas hu&ydot; seiden ȝwat schulle we nouþe? &punctelev; ho schal fo&rrot; us beo
ho schal us nouþe fram weo&rrot;re wite[MS. us wite]? &punctelev; ȝwodere schulle we nouþe fleo
ho schal nou pais in londe holde? &punctelev; o&rrot;e io&ydot;e is al ido
Of weo&rrot;re and wo we mouwen beo sikere &punctelev; al wrechhede comethþ us to.
¶Grete wille hadden þe guode Men men &punctelev; of þe contreie biside
In sum fair place þat bodi legge &punctelev; and souȝten it wel wide
hu&ydot; o&rrot;treuweden wel þat it were &punctelev; in sum foul &slong;tude ido
hu&ydot; souȝten it ofte wide aboute &punctelev; and ne couþen nouȝt come þerto
On a time ase þis guode men &punctelev; of ware&ydot;gne þare biside
In þe contre&ydot;e wenden and souȝten &punctelev; þis holie bodi ful wide
hu&ydot; &slong;toden and biheolden[MS. biheoldem] heom biside &punctelev; þo iseiȝen hu&ydot; gret liȝht
And cler withalle aboute one place &punctelev; ase apiler &slong;tonde up&rrot;iȝht
¶Hu&ydot; þouȝten þat þere was gode&slong; Godes grace. &punctelev; þudere hu&ydot; wenden and souȝte
And founden þere þis holie bodi &punctelev; and up of þe eo&rrot;þe it b&rrot;ouȝten
Þare was wop and so&rrot; inov &punctelev; þo hu&ydot; seiȝen is grisli wounde
Ake ȝeot was heo&rrot;e heo&rrot;te glad &punctelev; and Io&ydot;ful ioyful þo hu&ydot; him founde
With wel fair p&rrot;ocession &punctelev; þis bodi fo&rrot;th hu&ydot; bere
Into þe toun of wara&ydot;ne &punctelev; and faire it bureden þere
In a churcheȝerd of o&rrot;e leuedi &punctelev; bi e&slong;te þe churche a lu&ydot;te
Þare hu&ydot; bureden þat swete bodi &punctelev; with gret honur and p&rrot;u&ydot;te
A chapele þare is arerd &punctelev; ase þat holie bodi lai
In þe toun of war&ydot;gne &punctelev; þat &slong;tant ȝeot to þis dai
Þe put þare he was feo&rrot;&slong;t ifounde &punctelev; a welle þare gan sp&rrot;ingue
Fair and cler þat ȝeot ila&slong;t &punctelev; and is ofte gret botningue
Þat Men men cleopieth ȝeot to þis da&ydot; &punctelev; seint Edwardes welle;
þare Mani Miracle hath ibeo &punctelev; ase þe contreie dethþ telle
¶Þat holie bodi la&ydot; guode ȝw&ydot;le &punctelev; þare it was ido
In þe toune of wara&ydot;gne &punctelev; and Mani man cam þarto
Þe tiþingue hov he imartred was &punctelev; sone sp&rrot;ong wel wide
And þe Miracles miracles þat fo&rrot; him comen &punctelev; aboute in eche side
An heiȝ Eo&rrot;l eorl þare was alonde þo &punctelev; þat ihoten was Alfez
Þat seint Seint
Edward louede muche &punctelev; þe ȝw&ydot;le he liuede her
Þo he heo&rrot;de of þe Miracles miracles telle &punctelev; þat o&rrot;e louerd fo&rrot; him wrouȝte
Glad and bliþe he was inouȝ &punctelev; ase ech Man man wel ouȝte
him þouȝte it was wel vuele ido &punctelev; þat he lai so lowe þere
Þat he nere ibured in herre &slong;tude &punctelev; ase he wel wu&ydot;rþe were
Gret deol he hadde in is herte &punctelev; þat he was amo&rrot;þred so
And swuch a creature ase he was &punctelev; in so lowe &slong;tude ido
In deo&rrot;sete he wende wide aboute &punctelev; to þe heiȝe men alle þere
To Bischopes bischopes and to Abbodes abbodes also &punctelev; þat in Enguelonde were
And bad heom of þulke holie bodi &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; it þannes bere
To herre &slong;tude ase it was wu&ydot;rþe &punctelev; and þat hu&ydot; þareaȝein nere
his Messagers messagers he sende aboute &punctelev; fo&rrot; þis þing wel wide
And to þe Abbesse abbesse of wiltone Wiltone &punctelev; þat ihote was wilfride Wilfride
And to Eadithþe þe holie wumman &punctelev; þat Nonne nonne also was þar[o&rrot;ig. þer]
Þat was seint Seint
Edwardes su&slong;ter &punctelev; and þe kingus douȝter Edgar
So þat Bischopus bischopus and Abbodes abbodes &punctelev; and heiȝe Men men mani on
Togadere comen in a time &punctelev; ase hu&ydot; bispeken echon
¶To þis holi bodi hu&ydot; wenden. &punctelev; and þo hu&ydot; þerto come
hol and sound hu&ydot; founden it ligge &punctelev; þo hu&ydot; þat bodi up nome
Also hol it was withoute weomme &punctelev; ase it euer er aliue was
Þare nas nouȝt on þat it iseiȝ &punctelev; þat glad and Io&ydot;ful þerefo&rrot;e nas
Ake Eadithþe is holie su&slong;ter &punctelev; to þat bodi o&rrot;n anon
And biclupte þat bodi and cu&slong;te it fa&slong;te &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e heom euerechon
Fo&rrot; gladnesse heo lovȝ and weop &punctelev; teres wel mani on
Þo heo saiȝ hire b&rrot;oþur so aslawe &punctelev; and so sovnd of flechs and bon
hoso nadde neuere deol iseiȝe &punctelev; of hire he miȝhte þere
Þis heiȝe men with gret honur &punctelev; þat holie bodi fo&rrot;th bere
With gret song and p&rrot;ocession. &punctelev; muche folk þuderward d&rrot;ovȝ
Ore louerd dude þare fo&rrot; is loue &punctelev; fair Miracle inovȝ
¶ Fo&rrot; tweie crupeles þat in heo&rrot;e limes &punctelev; al furcrokede were
Mid gret hope leien in þe we&ydot; &punctelev; and abiden þe bere
ho&rrot;e limes bigunne to rechchen ariȝht &punctelev; and hole bicomen anon
Þare was Io&ydot;e ioye and blisse inouȝ &punctelev; among þis men echon
¶His &slong;tepmoder þat him þareto b&rrot;ouȝte &punctelev; herof herde telle
hire ofþouȝte þo he swuch man was &punctelev; þat he[= heo] him let so quelle
Ope hire palefre&ydot; heo werth a da&ydot; &punctelev; aftur þat bodi to wiende
To bidde fo&rrot;ȝiuenesse of hire misdede &punctelev; ȝif god God hire wolde siende
¶Ase heo wolde þuderward wiende &punctelev; and with hire mani on
hu&ydot; ne miȝhten make hire palefre&ydot; &punctelev; þat it ane fote wolde gon
hu&ydot; schouen it fa&slong;te fo&rrot;thþeward and d&rrot;owen &punctelev; and neuere þe betere it nas
Þe Quiene quiene þouȝte on hire misdede &punctelev; þat al þarefo&rrot;e it was
heo aliȝhte of hire palefre&ydot; &punctelev; and wolde afote gon
Toward þat holie co&rrot;s. &punctelev; ake heo nadde power non
Aȝeinward heo miȝhte wel gon &punctelev; ake fo&rrot;thþeward fo&rrot; noþing
Heo bilefte þo it was non oþur &punctelev; in gret deol and mourn&ydot;ng
Of hire misdedes heo repentede hire so&rrot;e &punctelev; ase manie Men men habbeth ised
And cam to guod mendement &punctelev; are þat heo were ded
¶ Þis Men men ladden þis holie bodi &punctelev; with gret honur and p&rrot;u&ydot;te
To þe Abbe&ydot;e abbeye of Schaftesburi &punctelev; þare ase he lijth ȝu&ydot;te
Among blake Nonnene nonnene þat þare beoth &punctelev; and also þare weren þo
Þat fram þe toun of wara&ydot;gne Waraygne &punctelev; is twenti Mile mile and mo
In þe no&rrot;thha[l]f of þe heiȝe Autere autere &punctelev; in þe walle biside
hu&ydot; leiden þis holie bodi &punctelev; þat manie men sechez wide
Into þulke Abbeie abbeie of Schafteburij &punctelev; seint Edward hu&ydot; ladde
Fo&rrot; þe k&ydot;ng Alfred is grauntsire &punctelev; þat hous arerd hadde
And made þarinne is douȝter Nonne nonne &punctelev; þat was ihote alȝ&ydot;ue
Fo&rrot; hire loue he hadde þat hous arerd &punctelev; and muche guod þudere in iȝiue
An hond&rrot;et hidenene[r. hidene] of guod lond &punctelev; with hire he ȝaf þer
Þat hous also freo in eche point &punctelev; ase he himsulf it heold er
In þis Abbeie abbeie
seint Seint
edward Edward &punctelev; lai on and twenti ȝer
So þat hu&ydot; iseien tokningue ofte &punctelev; þat he nolde nonmo&rrot;e beo þer
Fo&rrot; ȝwane men comen ofte to is toumbe &punctelev; ase liȝthliche up hu&ydot; as bere
And heuen as up and doun ase hu&ydot; wolden &punctelev; ase þei it liȝht treov were
¶ Seint Edward cam also aniȝht &punctelev; ase in a visioun
To an holi man þat þere was neiȝ &punctelev; in an oþur religion
Go he seide to Schafteburi &punctelev; to þe Abbesse abbesse of þe house
Dame Ald&rrot;ed þat clene Maide maide &punctelev; þat is gode&slong; Godes spouse
And seie hire þat inelle nonmo&rrot;e &punctelev; ligge þare ich nou do
Þat ich beo ib&rrot;ouȝt in an oþur &slong;tude &punctelev; and þat heo segge mi b&rrot;oþer so
¶Þis guode Man man amo&rrot;ewe aros &punctelev; and ne furȝat nouȝt þis cas
To þe Abbesse abbesse he wende of Schafteburi &punctelev; and tolde al hou it was
Þis guode womman was glad inouȝ! &punctelev; to þe k&ydot;ngue heo wende sone
And of is b&rrot;oþur tolde him al &punctelev; and ȝwat þerof were to done
Welle þe k&ydot;ng was one glad &punctelev; þo he iheo&rrot;de telle
So swete tiþingue of is b&rrot;oþur &punctelev; þei is moder him liete aquelle
¶He wolde habbe iwent to schafteburi Schafteburi &punctelev; In shrine him to b&rrot;ingue
Ac he was so biset mid weo&rrot;re &punctelev; þat he ne miȝhte fo&rrot; no þingue
Fo&rrot; is fon o&rrot;nen so fa&slong;te him upon &punctelev; þat he ne miȝhte þannes wiende
To heie Men men aboute in þe londe &punctelev; wel sone he gan siende
And to wilfin Wilfin þe guode bischop &punctelev; þat was bischop þo
Þat hu&ydot; scholden with gret honour &punctelev; to
schafteburie Schafteburie go
And his b&rrot;oþur in schrine b&rrot;ingue &punctelev; ase riȝth was fo&rrot;to done
¶Þe Bischop bischop with þis oþur Men men &punctelev; to schafteburi Schafteburi comen sone
With swiþe fair p&rrot;ocession &punctelev; to is toumbe hu&ydot; wende
A swiþe fair Miracle miracle among heom alle &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerd fo&rrot; him þere sende
Fo&rrot; anon so hu&ydot; openeden þat lid &punctelev; of is swete toumbe þere
Þare cam adoun þo&rrot;uȝ al þe churche &punctelev; ase þei it a mi&slong;t were
Among al þe p&rrot;ece þat þere was &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; iseien alle with eiȝe
Fleuȝ[al. flen] amon[g] heom also a m&ydot;&slong;t &punctelev; so swote þing neuere hu&ydot; er ne seiȝe
¶So swote was þe smul and guod &punctelev; þat alle þat þere were
Fo&rrot; muruþe þouȝten þat hu&ydot; &slong;toden &punctelev; in para&ydot;s and nouȝt þere
Þis holi bodi up hu&ydot; nomen &punctelev; with gret honour and p&rrot;u&ydot;te
And leiden it in a wel fair schrine &punctelev; þare ase it lijth ȝu&ydot;te
In þis manere he was ischrined &punctelev; in þe on an twentiþe ȝere
Þat þe heiȝe men him b&rrot;ouȝten fro waram &punctelev; and bureden him fur&slong;t þere
A þousend ȝer it was and on &punctelev; after þulke &slong;tounde
Þat o&rrot;e louerd was on eo&rrot;þe ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; and aliȝhte fo&rrot; us to grounde
¶His b&rrot;oþur þe king Aþeld&rrot;ed &punctelev; guod man was inouȝ
Edward was is sone ihote &punctelev; þat to alle guodnesse d&rrot;ouȝ
Þat king was sethþe aftur him &punctelev; and heiȝ halewe in heouene is
Icleoped seint Seint
Edward aftur is vncle &punctelev; at We&slong;tMun&slong;tre Westmunstre he lijth iwis
¶ Opon Opon Miȝhelmasse fourtenen&ydot;ȝht &punctelev; his da&ydot; fallez in þe ȝere
And amidde þe Monþe monþe of lu&ydot;de[18 March] &punctelev; seint Edwardes dai þere.[= þe ere]
Nov god God fo&rrot; þe loue of heom boþe &punctelev; þet swete kingues were
To þe Io&ydot;e ioye of heouene þat hu&ydot; beoth inne &punctelev; with heom us b&rrot;ingue þere
